conclusion: Need to analyze the graph of acceleration versus time to determine the speed of the elevator at t = 60 seconds.
Acceleration is positive from t = 1 to t = 5, and negative from t = 5 to t = 60.
The elevator is accelerating upward from t = 1 to t = 5 and decelerating downward from t = 5 to t = 60.
Speed can be calculated using the formula v = v_0 + at.
Since the acceleration is constant, the speed at t = 60 seconds is the same as the initial speed v_0.
The elevator starts from rest at t = 0, so the initial speed v_0 is 0.
The speed at t = 60 seconds is 0.
The graph shows that the acceleration is constant from t = 1 to t = 5, and then from t = 5 to t = 60.
The elevator is at rest at t = 60.
Conclude that the speed of the elevator at t = 60 seconds is 0.
